bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 164, Number 46 (Thursday, March 15, 2018)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. NADLER:H.R. 5296.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:U.S. Constitution, Article I, Section 8, Clause 18,[Page H1652]

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

summary.text: This bill makes technical amendments to the U.S. Code to revise references to statutory provisions classified to Title 2 (The Congress).

bill.title: To make technical amendments to update statutory references to certain provisions classified to title 2, United States Code.

item.title: To make technical amendments to update statutory references to certain provisions classified to title 2, United States Code.
To make technical amendments to update statutory references to certain provisions classified to title 2, United States Code.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
